main event: On August 19, 1956, in Donora, Pennsylvania, a UFO was reported to be observed for one hour and thirty-five minutes. The object appeared to be round in shape to the naked eye and triangular in shape through binoculars. It was yellow-white in color and moved in a clockwise, rectangular pattern, changing its direction multiple times. The sighting was made visually using binoculars and the report concluded that it was probably astronomical.
interesting points: The UFO was observed for an extended period of one hour and thirty-five minutes.
The object appeared to be round in shape to the naked eye and became triangular in shape through binoculars.
It had a reddish brown trail, and its size was compared to the North Star or a little smaller than a dime held at arm's length.
The object moved in a clockwise, rectangular pattern, and changed its direction multiple times, indicating a controlled movement.
The conclusion of the report suggested that the object was probably astronomical in nature.
witnesses: Civilians, including a 12-year-old and an Assistant Group Operations Officer
